001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.annotations;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.base.ComponentType;
004import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
005import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
006import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
007import java.lang.annotation.Target;
008import org.openqa.selenium.support.FindBy;
009
010/**
011 * Marks a UI field for dynamic component insertion.
012 *
013 * <p>This annotation is used to define UI input fields that require automated handling,
014 * such as text fields, dropdowns, and checkboxes, by specifying their locator,
015 * type, and order of interaction.
016 *
017 * <p>It is commonly applied to DTO-like classes representing UI forms, where it
018 * helps automate interactions with form elements.
019 *
020 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
021 */
022@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
023@Target(ElementType.FIELD)
024public @interface InsertionField {
025
026   /**
027    * Specifies the locator strategy for identifying the UI field.
028    *
029    * @return The Selenium {@link FindBy} locator used to locate the field.
030    */
031   FindBy locator();
032
033   /**
034    * Defines the component type for this field.
035    *
036    * <p>This should be class implementing {@link ComponentType},
037    * allowing the framework to determine how to interact with the UI element.
038    *
039    * @return The component type class.
040    */
041   Class<? extends ComponentType> type();
042
043   /**
044    * Specifies the string identifier of the component type.
045    *
046    * <p>This identifier is usually an enum value representing the
047    * UI framework component (e.g., "MD_INPUT_TYPE" for Material Design inputs).
048    *
049    * @return The string identifier for the component type.
050    */
051   String componentType();
052
053   /**
054    * Defines the order in which this field should be processed.
055    *
056    * <p>Lower values indicate higher priority in execution order.
057    *
058    * @return The order value for processing this field.
059    */
060   int order();
061
062}
